review: I would like to add the beverage manager ended up comping the entire bill.  I left the bill amount on the table for the waitress.  I was not looking for a free ride by complaining.

I had a great experience here, with 1 minor issue. The waitress was awesome. Very friendly.  The minor issue, my burger was served at room temperature. To me, it's not a big deal, but, it was a little surprising. Everything else, I had no complaints.  Thank you,  whoever you are, for the excellent service.
We don't come here for the service. Luckily, food is soooo good. But u have to ask for plates, knives & napkins?

You would think that a place known for burgers would beat Five Guys, or at least equal it. Nope, sorry, Red Robin isn't even close. The waiter was pleasant but his upsell tactics wore thin by the end of the meal. Me: "I'd like a raspberry ice tea please." Server: "Sure, you said a Long Island Ice Tea, right?" Me: "Sigh, no a regular one." Our first mistake was the chips and french onion dip appetizer for $3. It was worth no more than $3 as it consisted of a plate of (I guess) fresh made chips and a weird cold ranch-y onion dip. Disappointing. My blue cheese burger was cooked ok but it was lukewarm, there were very little blue cheese crumbles on it, and overall it was just a very bland burger. Another disappointment. You also only get a little cup of steak fries. Sure, the fries are "bottomless" as they say, but who the heck wants to wait for more fries? Just give a good amount to begin with. Needless to say, we'll never go back as I don't appreciate being badgered to pay more $$$ for liquor, dessert, etc. and the burger was very underwhelming. Too bad.

Ate there this evening. We had a short wait for our table. Our waitress spoke waaaay too fast, had zero sense of humor, but who cares? The food is AWESOME!!! The iPad thingy on the table is confusing. The prices are reasonable. The food really is good. We'll be back!
No WiFi?  WTF!  The owner needs to embrace technology and this century and get with the program, dude!  No wonder the place is empty.  YOU'RE FIRED!

I have had some problems with red robin in the past with rude customer service, seeing my food left at the warm rack and then when the food came was told that they were busy when clearly they were not. Complained to corporate and with the vouchers still got shitty food and told myself I would never come back. 2 yrs later I gave them a try and have to say is that I will come back. They must have cleaned house and the burgers and fries were better than ever.

I have only been to a Red Robin once before (in PA), and I should start by saying  not a huge fan of chain restaurants. But, we were on the go and needed something fast, and we were starving/craving burgers.  If I didn't have the prior visit to a different location to compare this to, I would have assumed all Red Robins were like this experience. Unfortunately, everything was super greasy and oily. The burger and bun were literally soaked in oil/grease and would drip when being lifted off the plate. My husband had the guacamole burger and he said it was not as greasy as mine and much tastier. So different from the past experience. Also, at the other location, we received bottomless fries as soon as we sat down. Here we had to ask for them, and she still didn't bring them out until our whole meal came out (keep in mind we were starving;) Maybe it was just an off cook/day for them? Also, as a side note, there was a manager meeting at the table next to ours and we could hear the whole meeting. It was awkward because an employee was being reprimanded and it became a little loud at some points.  Overall, not horrible, just not as good as the other location we went to.
Eric  was good even met with manager ...fast service  food just right ...beer was cold :) this was our 2nd or 3rd time here well worth a trip

On the night of our visit,  Red Robin offered a buy 1 double burger, get 1 free meal when you purchased two drinks. .  We arrived and were promptly seated. Our waiter took our drink order and explained the deal. My husband enjoyed the  double burger with french fries. My garden burger was tasty but the sauce, a country dijon, was very spicy. the attentive manager who was visiting tables brought me a new roll and I chose ciabatta instead of wheat.  that was an improvement.  My mistake was that I had the bagged shredded lettuce on it rather than fresh romaine.  I chose broccoli as my side and it was very plain so i requested olive oil to give it some flavor.   Lots of good choices and adjustments on the menu of which I was unaware - next time!

Went to red robin on a Saturday night and was surprised at how empty it was- until we experienced the service.  My first complaint was that the floors were REALLY slippery, and mentioned it to the hostess who basically agreed with me. Then after browsing the menu, we ordered some drinks. For a place with only 5 tables, we expected quick service but that was not the case. After finally ordering and another long wait, we received our food-yay? Too bad the pineapple wasn't grilled and the bacon was cold on my friend's undercooked burgers. I ordered some doughnuts, as I just wanted dessert. They were out of berry dipping sauce, and my server told me someone was making more. It tasted like jelly mixed with water, and it was far from appetizing. After clearing the plates, our server never came back, and we paid on the kiosk at the table and left cash because she never came to collect it. Ran into her as we slipped all over the floor and out of that red robin forever.

Jenny the bar tender just made me the best drink I've ever had. Told her to go crazy and make it whatever she wanted. It's amazing. I asked her what it was called so I could order it again. She said she just added a bunch of sweet alcohols and some juice. She's invited to all my parties from now on. Left her a $20 tip. The burgers were ok too.

Third time not the charm . Dropped in for something after shopping coffee was old and apparently so. Service was bad no spoons no creamer had to wait for sugar. Food took awhile everyone's food was fine . But mine. Luke warm gourmet burger. SAD . Really expected more . And it wasn't even busy. May go back as I've been a few times . But not a goto burger place anymore . SAD !

Just not feeling this place the gluten free burgers are very small on two occasions my burger came out cold the sweet potato fries on my last visit came out cold as well. Honestly in my opinion the burgers are far from gourmet in fact there pretty close to what you would see at McDonald's or Wendy's at three times the price it's just not worth it.

The food was good no doubt about that .. even thou it did take an unusual amount of time for the onion ring tower to come out .. i had to ask if they made the onion rings on the spot just cause it took too long ....  i was upset with our waitress the only good thing is that she had a smile .. but she never checked up on me or refilled my water voluntarily .. i did notice thou she payed more attention to the other tables mind u it was the bar section ....  AL the bartender was awesome thou full of life i kinda wanted him to be my server ... then i noticed a different employee (could of been supervisor or manager) came to check on us cause she said i had this look like i needed something which was true .. but at that point i was already mad at the service. ..  it was my first time at red robin but idk if ill come back ... im all about customer service and i did not receive that ...

Have heard bad rumors about the place but every time I go service is fantastic and food is excellent i sit in the bar area because there are fewer children running around me and my wife Always order our burgers cooked different and they're always spot on so I will be going back as soon as possible if you've had a bad experience before maybe your going at the wrong time

We ate lunch there on a Friday around 1130. Waitress was very interested in getting us signed up for their rewards card. My son's kids meal was suppose to be chicken with little wooden toothpicks. When the food arrived the waitress apologize because they ran out of toothpicks. We wish she came over prior and told us about the problem we would of changed the order for him.  Endless fries are a joke. I finished my fries first and then my burger before the endless fries showed up. In addition, the portion was small. I was never asked about more fries again. However, the waitress did take time to ask us to give her a  high rating on the customer feedback portion.  The burgers were good but we get better service and burgers at Applebee's in Smithfield, RI.

Place is a joke. If you like deep fried, frozen food you'll enjoy this place. Decided to try something other than a burger and that was a huge mistake!!!! Ordered a grilled chicken sandwich and it was a rubbery, frozen, heated in the microwave piece of garbage. For the price the place is a ripoff. Don't bother. You're better off at Wendy's or BK. Never again #RedRobin
The Worst !!!! Do not waste your time or money. The portions were extremely small and expensive. I recommend Texas Longhorn next door.

I've been here twice, and both times were much less than enjoyable.  Now, I know, it's a chain restaurant, but the service and the level of food was subpar at best.  Our waiter had no clue what he was doing.  We had a larger party, which again, I know can be difficult, but it took over half an hour for us to get our drinks and even longer than that for him to actually take our food order.  My hopes were not high for the quality of this meal, but little did I know, they would be dashed even worse than expected.  When I recieved my grilled bruchetta sandwich, it was quite obvious that it had been sitting around while the rest of the orders were completed.  The bottom bun of the sandwich whats soggy to the point that it fell apart the minute I picked it up.  I informed the waiter of this fact to which I recieved a blank stare.  I had to ask him to bring me another sandwhich to which I did not even hear a muttering of apology.  10 awkward minutes later spent watching everyone else eat their meals, they brought me another sandwhich, which prompltly also fell apart and I ended up having to eat it with a knife and fork.  All in all the meal took over 2 hours, which in the setting of a birthday dinner was fine, but had we been planning on having timely meal, we would have been furious. All of this being said, the manager did come and apologize for my meal and was very friendly and nice.  It almost seemed as if he was subconciously apologizing for the embarrasment of his staff.

We were seated near the kitchen by chance and could hear our waitress (named Abby) openly bad mouthing us for getting water at 9pm on a Monday or a Tuesday and ordering a french onion soup. Poisonous attitude that's pretty much spread around this place for a while from all negativity coming from all the waitresses that apparently dislike their current jobs from what they are saying. They say they'd rather work at Buffalo wild wings across the street.

I wish I could give this place less than one star. The food and service is god awful. What part of "burger perfection" includes a disgusting limp patty made out of flavorless, overly processed beef. Furthermore, Red Robin is the only place on the face of the earth who could manage to fry something and have it not taste good, let alone ethereal. Bottomless steak fries? You mean flavorless sticks of soggy, limp cardboard? I'm good. The service? Forget it. Completely clueless.  Forget this place.

The wife wrapped up work early today and wanted to go out to lunch with the baby and I. She also wanted to stop by the Rhode Island Mall. We decided to grab a burger at Red Robin. The last time we at Red Robin was in Arizona.  We arrived around 2 pmish, the place was dead (It must get busier for dinner). It took us about 2 minutes to be seated. Our waiter Chuck was Great. He was very friendly and very accommodating.  We ordered onion rings for appetizers they were delicious, wife ordered a burger and I ordered a bacon burger with bacon. While looking at the menu, I noticed they sell those cool glass cups, I ask chuck if I can buy a few for the house? How much are they? Chuck replies " $ 3 or $ 4 let me ask my manager. Chuck comes back states they dont have those glasses in stock, they have the coors light cans. I ask him to show them to me. He does, I say what the heck their $4 bucks let me buy a couple. The manager comes over, I ask him why no glasses he says " well we really dont carry them???? Hmmm then why you trying to sell them on your menu???  Not a big deal! Thats one of the reasons I got out of retail, good help is hard to find! So Im trying to keep my 3 month old son occupied, the burgers show up. Im eating while taking care of the baby. My wife says hows the bacon burger, now mind you i am half way done. Im like BACON what BACON???? She replies you ordered a bacon cheeseburger didn't you??? So I lift the bun, I look and guess what NO BACON!!! So I ask Chuck did I order a Bacon Cheesburger he says yeah. I lift the top of the burger wheres the BACON??? Again here comes the Manager, I know what he was thinking half the burger is gone this guys trying to pull a fast one. Manager says do you want BACON, I say no its ok not a big deal, he says well I will only charge you for a Cheesburger.  So after getting home and jumping on my laptop, I am thinking. The place maybe had 10 customers in the entire place. How did your staff forget the BACON???? Fyi to the General Manager... you should probably order more glass cups to build your incremental sales, instead of offering the sauces for .50 additional !!!

Don't let them seat you near the bar your server will be the bartender and they attend to the people at the bar more often. Waited about 20 minutes to put in an order on a slow night .... Good food terrible service

I'd love to give a higher rating, but our visit last night was a letdown. We have come to this location for about 10 months, about once or twice a month. This was our second visit this week with family (who we had to persuade to go since during our visit a few days ago it had taken 48 minutes to get our entrees even after we were seated in the booth). The waitress tried to keep on top of the negatives, but it was kind of hard. Last night, our drinks (soda) took a while due to both machines needing some sort of filter maintenance, then our appetizer never came. Our waitress was very busy the whole time, so our first opportunity to talk to her came when she brought out our entrees. She checked and someone in the back had forgotten to make the appetizer, and it was just being started and would not be ready in time for us to eat it before our meals got cold. We asked for it to be boxed, which it was; the item was missing its sauce, which we found out after we had left. I asked for a refill on our drinks, and it never came. At that point, we just paid using the kiosk box on the table and left. Food was excellent, service is slipping. :(

We went here the other night with our two teens. The restaurant is nice enough - seemed clean, I liked the stuff they had and there's a full bar. Our waitress was very good, which is unusual these days. All four of us ordered burgers, no special orders, straightforward.  We waited about 40 minutes for our burgers to arrive, which for a Monday night is inexcusable. Burgers don't take that long, especially when there's barely anyone in the joint.  My burger was fair. The meat was ok I suppose, but for nearly $10 I expected a substantially sized patty. It was lost in the bun and toppings. My wife's burger was ok too, nothing special. The boys, they're teens so they'll eat pretty much anything put in front of them. They seemed happy enough. To be brief - these burgers were not nearly as delicious as Five Guys, twice as expensive as Five Guys, and took far too long to get to the table. On the plus side, Red Robin has beer. This was too expensive for just an ok burger. Not a fan.

Very slow! Don't come for a "quick lunch." I've been dragged here 3 times and each time the service was friendly but slow and disinterested. Not like that in the OH branches where I used to live. Burgers made with frozen, pre-pressed thin patties, not hand crafted. If you want a refill on your bottomless steak fries, better order it right away or you'll be done with your burger when they arrive

So, we received a message from a manager to discuss our concerns by phone, after which we were asked to come back and try the restaurant again. She seemed genuinely concerned and wanted to know whether similar things had happened there more than once.  She offered us a gift card to give them another try, so we figured it couldn't hurt.  It came in the mail the following week and we tucked it away for an opportune moment (they're more rare these days with a toddler and an infant, which is why it took us nearly 2 months to make it back).  We were also supposed to let the manager we'd spoken with know when we arrived, but she wasn't on at the time (sorry, Sarah, we did try!). In any case, things went much better this time.  The food was hot and delicious, the waiter was friendly and attentive, and when the fries took longer than anticipated coming from the kitchen he popped by to let us know that they were on the way and he hadn't forgotten them.  Really, that's all it takes to keep us happy.  We don't abuse our wait staff and don't ask for much- we had one refill each on beverages and fries.  Even if we hadn't had the gift card, we would have left much more satisfied this time, and chafed less at the price, since we really felt like we got our money's worth this time. So, amended rating- five stars for this visit, averaged with 2 from the last review, makes 3.5 (rounded up to 4 since that's convention).  I hope they're able to maintain consistency in service in the future.

Ok came back only because they gave me a $15.00 certificate.  Burger was very good this time, but table and chairs are filthy, floor was a lot cleaner.  Think I have given this place enough chances.   You will not see me here again.  Maybe a different location, but not even sure I would do that.

I have wanted to try this place forever!  Well it wasn't what I had hoped for. I thought it would be a "out of this world" burger since its their specialty. It was mediocre, nothing special. I got the Burning Love burger, not much to it added pickles ketchup and mayo.  The onion rings were good but my friends fries were ice cold, and her daughters kids meal was too.  Our waitstaff was really slow and there were literally 10 parties and 3 waitresses.  We waited 5 mins for napkins, literally 10mins for a drink refill request.  I don't understand the slow service.  I probably. Won't go back there. Not worth it.  Also $17.32 for a burger and soda? Bit steep, no?
I enjoy the bar area. Its a nice environment, and a vastly improved service experience. The southern charm is delicious. All of the "finest" burgers are fantastic.

One of the best burgers I've had in my 34 years. I got the "Whiskey River BBQ Burger", and it was just amazing. I was offered mayo with my fries, that's a first!   Minus one star for; fruit flies crashing our meal, mealy giant steak fries, iceberg lettuce, and the slightly inflated prices.
I love Red Robin food, but you don't come here for the service.  Every time I visit RR, it takes FOREVER for the drinks, food and bill to come.. What can you do, right?

We arrived at 1 pm and stood by the unattended hostess stand for 10 mins waiting to b seated. Several employees walked by us and never acknowledged our existence. No greetings or we'll b right with u. We took this as a bad omen and left. We won't b back.

I gave it a shot when they opened, again when my friend wanted to use a gift card and once more for a birthday.  Unfortunately I've never had a good experience. I'd take a Five Guys over this burger any day. Service is spotty at best, the chicken I tried was dry and over battered and the price isn't as good as many suggest. Rather than 3 times the charm... 3 strikes and you're out.

Food Good  Customer Service horrible  x 10 Wanted part of my meal before the other.  Not an unusaul request but denied me. Will never be back... You are horrible. cancel my Red Robin Reward card Dave Barras

This is a poor excuse for a restaurant. I sent back my meal 4 times last night. The waiter was extremely rude. First my drink my disgusting , then he brought back the drink for a second time in a dirty cup then I sent it back once more for a new one and he dumped the same drink from the dirty cup in the new cup but it gets better. He gets our burgers wrong and under cooks them to the point where we weren't able to eat them. Extremely disappointment. I will NEVER be eating at this nasty place again. I will not be recommending this place . STAY AWAY. The manager though Jessica was great. She was very helpful and handled the problem.

I had heard horror stories about this place when it first opened, but I really wanted to give it a chance. I waited months after its opening to try it, figuring they had gotten off to a rough start. We came in at an off hour and the place was pretty dead. The food took awhile to arrive, which was fine since we were in no rush, but I cant imagine how slow it would have been if it had been busy. I ordered my burger medium well, and it arrived pink and bloody. The staff was friendly, and they gave me a new burger, but it messed up the timing of the meal. The burger was just ok. It's too bad, I really wanted to like this place.

We just left Red Robin. The host sat us down as soon as we walked it. Wasn't busy but a steady day!  We ordered the serve was very attentive and gave us our drinks in a timely manner.  We ordered and my bfn had hair in his food like a big hunk of hair. But they took care of that fast. The manager came over apologzed the servers apologized. And comped the burger. It' was a breath of fresh air to see the time work and see that they really care about there customers.  We will be definitely be going back  :)  Loved it  And the Pear-tini was good

Crappy food, crappy service. We ate here a few weeks ago at the bar on a Saturday night for our one and only visit. The bar itself wasn't busy but the bar tables mostly were. Our bartender seemed overwhelmed the whole time repeatedly getting help from the server in the lounge, other staff, and what looked to be a manager, yet barely had a full bar. She wasn't overly friendly, but wasn't rude either, just going through the motions... Was prompt with taking our drink orders and very fast making them, but very slow to take our order. She either forgot to ring in our appetizer or the kitchen took forever to make it. We only ordered guacamole and chips yet it took over 25 minutes to come out, then our meals came less then 5 minutes after that...the couple next to us got their meal before their app came out. She was slow on checking on our food, we wanted a side of dressing and had to flag down another server for it picking up her drinks cause our bartender was busy then disappeared for a few minutes. The food wasn't that good either, but at least the mixed drinks were really good... Still wouldn't go back after that experience.

Red Robin creates quite an illusion in their advertisements. What appears to be big, hearty pub style burgers in their slick commercials, ended up having more in common with chains like SONIC. The Pig Out Style bacon burger I ordered was somewhat small, and average. Nothing to write home about there.  The endless fries gimmick was quite a disappointment too. I'd rather have one decent batch of fries, than get a scant 10 French fries, and then, wonder when I might catch the wait staff's attention to bring me another dose. I did ask for a second helping, and they eventually arrived. Of course, by that point I was long since done with my meal, and ready to pay the bill.   In summation, the food isn't terrible, more akin to a middling fast food burger joint.  Essentially you are paying more for the ambience of the restaurant chain, than a great burger. If I'm going to do that, I'd probably go with a place like JOHNNY ROCKETS, and be much more satisfied with the food.
Bad service and poor food quality.  Soda had no carbonation.  No menu that summarizes toppings and waitstaff screwed up order and brought wrong order.

The hostess was pretty terrible and made it seem as if we were troubling her with our existence. We were then brought to the table where we met our waitress who was less than welcoming. About 10-15 mins later we ordered our dinner and appetizer. It took quite a while for the food to come out and then they brought us the wrong order. When i was able to flag someone down to let them know about the mix up the waitress inspected the burger, brought it to the back and then came back with the same burger about 10 mins later and said: "The order was right and this is what you ordered." She then proceeded to plop down the food (which was most definitely NOT what i ordered) and walked away. I didn't see her again until the check came and was plopped down in a similar fashion to the burger which i didn't end up eating. No checking on drinks, no fry refills, nothing.  Awful. 2 stars for the onion ring tower, and the onion ring tower alone. If you're torturing yourself by going here at least do yourself a favor and go for the rings. Only thing which didn't disappoint during our visit.

This was our first time at Red Robin, and I wasn't impressed and will never go back. The burgers are ok, what do you expect from a chain. They are over priced for no reason, the endless fries are a joke. The unlimited refills on drinks is a joke. The service in this location is horrible, and I know it because I watched people get up and go look for food and drinks so it wasn't only my experience. I received 6 fries with my burger, 6. I ordered lemonade with my drink and I got a cup of ice with some lemonade. I asked for a order of fries and a refill of my drink and the waitress went to go clean the booths that were already clean and walk around. At the time we had about 4 empty booths around us and that's what everyone was concerned about. About 10 minutes after I was done eating 7 fries and a drink magically appeared and we just wanted to leave. At several points of the evening all of the waiters and waitresses just disappeared somewhere. That's when several tables went looking for food. We received our food before other tables that had already been sitting for a while. So I wasn't impressed at all I will stick with my usual spots for burgers, I can get better quality for a third of the price.

A short preface by saying I have worked food service before so I tend to be more lenient when it comes to restaurants. Tonight's service is definitely up there with poor quality. I've been to this location before and it wasn't nearly as bad as it was tonight. We got there about 7:07p and, for a Monday, waited about ten minutes before being seated in the bar area. I had ordered the red sangria, I generally will only get one drink if I go out for dinner but when this arrived it tasted like watered down red wine. Long story short on the sangria the waitress informed me that it was box sangria. As I mentioned "when" the waitress came over to take our order was twenty minutes after we got there.    Despite my best attempts I try not to be terribly picky, especially when something is on the menu, my wife ordered a "Pig out Tavern Double" burger with cheddar cheese and fries and myself had requested a "Southern Charm" burger in a lettuce wrap with sweet potato fries. Halfway through the wait on our meal, the wait was about another twenty minutes, the waitress came over to inform me that they ran out of lettuce for the lettuce wrap.... yes... they ran out of lettuce. So I told her she could just put it on a plate and that would be fine.   All the while my wife and I are sitting there waiting and our waitress and the other servers are texting, cleaning up for the night it seemed and overall not checking in with us for any reason. By the time our food arrived we had cold fries, and a burger with some iceburg lettuce stacked on top and bottom, where my wife's meal looked like something we could have ordered from McDonald's and it had American cheese that looked like someone just opened up a few slices of Kraft singles. This is far from what I would justify to anyone as a "gourmet" burger being part of their slogan.   Around 7:58 our plates had been empty for a while, and yet the waitstaff just keeps walking by us, there are three of them now and not a single one looked over or said anything as small as " let me get those out of the way for you". Eight o'clock rolls around and still nothing, finally our waitress comes over to see if we would like a refill on the fries, so we indulge and say sure. Another ten minutes later fries arrive, also cold to luke warm and covered in oil. I could not get out of there fast enough. We paid and picked up to leave. The real kick was on our way out, the hostess was looking down at her phone the whole time and never said anything as simple as "Have a good night" or "Thanks for coming".  All in all, a "gourmet" dinner for two took over an hour and a half to "enjoy" with some of the worst service I've had in a long time. I would have bet there were no more than twenty or so customers inside at any given point during my ordeal.  Advice: Go to Long horn right next door, may be a little more expensive but the quality and service is better.

Just got home from the Warwick, RI Red Robin location. Walked in and as we were being seated I almost fell down because the floor was so slippery. I'm not sure if the floor was wet or just washed, but there were no wet floor signs so I'm assuming that the cleaning products used just made the floor slippery. I ended up pulling a muscle in my back and in my arm from trying to catch my fall. The hostess asked me if I was okay right after, I replied yes because I was pretty much embarrassed that I was falling in the first place. When I sat down, is when I felt the discomfort in my back and arm from the potential fall. The waitress came over (which I'm sure she saw my fall because she was in the kitchen, which we were seated near) and didn't ask me if I was okay, she just wanted to take me and my friends order immediately. I could tell she was a little annoyed. We had no idea the kitchen closed at 10 pm we walked in at 9:05 pm, we also asked the hostess prior to being seated if we were too late to come in because we could have gone somewhere else that was open close-by. ANYWAY, I wanted to order a vegetarian/vegan burger, but didn't see anything listed on the menu because I felt so rushed (and the menu's design is super confusing and clustered). So I had to go with a salad and fries. I am lactose intolerant so when I received my order I saw cheese on the garlic fries I was a little surprised (again because I felt rushed and didn't read the menu thoroughly), and also found 2 pieces of mac and cheese in my HOUSE SALAD. I pushed the shredded cheese off of my fries, but I wasn't totally positive all of the cheese was off. I didn't want to make a big stink because my friend and I wanted to get out of there and as I said earlier the waitress was annoyed. Towards the second half of our experience the waitress was nicer than she was (most likely because a family of 3 came in at 9:43 pm and she didn't have a reason to be annoyed with us anymore). Moreover, I'm glad I have a couple of Lactaid pills at home so I don't feel sick tonight, and a heating pad/ice.  Sorry for the bad review, but I had to be honest.

I would choose zero stars if that were an option.  We went to the location next to the Warwick Mall complex and it was one of the most disappointing dining experiences that we have ever had the displeasure of enduring.  It took over 45 minutes for our food to arrive, even though it wasn't busy.  Really?  Forty-five minutes for burgers and fries?   The other negative aspect of our visit is that I went out of my way to specifically ask for a PLAIN cheeseburger with just bacon on it.  Forty-five minutes later, my meal arrived and when I bit into it, there were mushrooms, which I am very allergic to.   When I brought this to the attention of our server, she aggressively tried to place the onus on us by maintaining that my sister-in-law must have taken my order by mistake.  My sister-in-law had, in fact, ordered a mushroom cheeseburger and that was what she got.  To summarize, even though only one cheeseburger with mushrooms was ordered, two of them were delivered to our table.  So either this overly contentious waitress messed up the order, or the kitchen did.   Also, not once during this interaction did the waitress ask how I was or express any concern that a customer had been erroneously served a meal with ingredients that he/she was allergic to.  Fortunately, there were no ill effects, but this should not be the attitude and reaction when something like this occurs. Furthermore, arguing with customers, especially when you are in the wrong, is not only bad form, but it is also bad business.  To her credit, once the waitress realized that a mistake had been made, she said a corrected order would be expedited within a "few" minutes, but it took another 25 minutes.  Apparently, in Red Robin world, it normally takes 45 minutes to cook a hamburger, but in a pinch, they can expedite it in only 25 minutes. Lastly, they did not even have the business acumen and/or public relations sense to take the offending burger off our bill.  Perhaps I should have pressed the issue, but by that point, I just wanted to get out of there as fast as I could, rather than prolonging the agony. I blame most of this on poor management.  We will not be returning to this restaurant.

This place is usually okay with decent service. I really like their wings and enjoy their burgers. But from experience, I'd rather sit in the bar area, where there are less errors! This was our first time in the dining room. During my most recent visit my server was new and was polite.  However, it took 3 tries to get an actual seltzer for my boyfriend (she always brought over different ones - first time it was tonic). When I advised that tonic was different she explained she didn't know the difference.  Then, I asked if they had the wings with the bone-in, not boneless. She explained they only have boneless. I then pointed out wings and chips and asked what the difference was. She explained that there wasn't any. Then I questioned her on that it seemed different...and she advised that she was mistaken and they do have the wings with the bone-in but you only get 4 of them. My boyfriend really wanted to get them so I did so.  She only charged us $5, meaning we could had done the actual one that I requested for $9 and probably would had more wings.   She also questioned me when I told her it was my birthday and she pretty much doubted me. She explained it would had automatically popped up in the system if it was my birthday. I advised her with the email and my birthdate. She also had to get her manager to figure it out. Her manager advised I was unable to get a free black angus order and just took off the most she could on a burger. I advised that it was okay. Our waitress never apologized nor wished me a happy birthday. She was argumentative when it came to the wings.  The service there was very slow and it was a Sunday and quiet. We waited over an hour and a half for just our food to come and never any updates besides one; because of the burger you ordered it takes longer. There were never any updates. A request for another seltzer took at least a half hour for one seltzer.   Also, when the wings came I requested blue cheese - which never ever came. This place can certainly improve as I know they have some new employees. Every table served I heard the manager apologizing for a number of errors from their wait staff. Hopefully, their place and service will be faster and better.

I was very disappointed in my meal. I ordered the "clucks" (chicken fingers) in "buzz sauce" (buffalo) with Mac n cheese.  Problems:  1)There was basically no "buzz sauce" involved at all. The "clucks" were dry and had no appreciable "buzz" flavor whatsoever.  2) There were only 4 "clucks" and one was a runt of the "cluck" litter and was only one bite's worth of food. 3)While the Mac n cheese was good, they gave me about a spoonful and half of it.  4) All of the above would have been annoying but tolerable had this been a $7 appetizer but as a ~$12 entree it was a terrible value.  I typically enjoy RR but do yourself a favor and stick to the burger menu. The "clucks" in "buzz sauce" with Mac n cheese is a colossal waste of your money.

After trying other Red Robin locations before, we were expecting at least a halfway decent experience at this one.  Were we wrong. Everything was a bad experience and ultimately a waste of my time and money. The menu looks great, but the food that actually got delivered and the quality of service of those waiting on us was horrible.  First, we were seated in the bar area and our waitresses were the team of bartenders, so they were already in a position of disadvantage having two areas to tend to, but that was no excuse for the piss-poor service. Both waitresses conveyed an attitude that we were interrupting their day by being seated away from the bar. They rushed us through our order and missed a couple things in the process.  The beverages came out with foodstuff stuck to the straws as if someone bussed a table and then made my drink. When we asked for a new one, that's where things really turned: we were completely ignored for the rest of the time. Every table around us was checked on but once we raised a concern we were blacklisted.  When the food came out it was well over cooked, sloppy in presentation and took forever. We actually debated walking out a few moments before it arrived. When we got it, it was incorrect and missing anything we added - but they were sure to put it on the check! We stared at the culinary embarrassment placed in front of us for about twenty minutes before the manager (Dave) finally came over. To his credit, he did take off the items and apologized, but my experience has been so poor that it has influenced me to avoid the chain all together.  In summary, the menu looked good but the food was mediocre at best.

The worst customer service. 10 minutes for a drink order and the waiter was completely incompetent. Not to mention he screwed the bill up 2 times and over charged us. Never again will I being going here.

Came here on a Friday night with my Husband and son.  We were seated immediately. Waitress came over and greeted herself, letting us know that all the drinks and sides were bottomless.  We put in our drink order and appetizer order. Appetizers never came.  Took some time for the food to come out 20 minutes with the meals came the appetizers.  I'm pretty sure appetizers come before the main meal.  -but what do I know? Once everything came out our drinks were gone. We asked for refills and 10 minutes later we still didn't receive our refills. My husband called the waiter over as she delivered an alcoholic beverage to the table next to us (which ordered their drink after us).  She stated she has to wait for the bar tender to make them prior to us receiving them.  15 minutes later we got our drinks.  We asked for additional napkins and she never brought them.  The ONLY and I mean ONLY thing that happened quickly was receiving our check.  Thank you, we won't be visiting in the future.   Updated review: I'd first like to thank Katie (the owner) for contacting me after my first review.  I was surprised to find a $20 gift card in my email 2 days after speaking with her.  We went to your restaurant tonight and I would be happy to let you know that the server Marissa today was fantastic.  She is a great model for your staff to aspire to.  She was polite, professional, and was always willing to share her favorites off the menu with us.   She made our 2nd experience better.  I will say the restaurant was a lot busier this time around and it seems like the restaurant is starting to get their sh*t together.  Alcoholic drinks seemed to have no alcohol in them.  Good burgers.  My favorite would be southern charm.

OK, thought we would try a gourmet burger. The place was clean, seated right away in the Bar area where no kids are allowed a huge plus and I which all restaurants would have enough sense to do this. The down side is they screwed up my order, I asked for no lettuce/mayo, the waiter wrote it down but the cooked made the mistake. Then they took it back scraped off the lettuce /mayo threw on a new bun and brought it right back, lol. Anyway it was a good burger but not worth the price. We wont be back.

The fries are not bad, small portion but they offer to bring more (if you are willing to wait)... that concludes anything positive I can say about this place. The chicken sandwich was so salt/chemical infused as to actually cause my mouth pain. The burger tasted like a low quality over cooked puck. The cost of the burden you are about to put yourself through, about $11 to $15 plus per assault in a bun; which is to say significantly over priced. Go just about anywhere else.

This restaurant has gotten increasingly worse each time I've come here. It started off great.. excellent service and great food... A few months ago I came for dinner with my sister, and they were out of 3 menu items she wanted. The server felt bad and comped us some extra sides.. Today I came with the kids for lunch. First, we waited to be seated, and then we waited over 30 mins for food to arrive. My clucks were gummy inside and the mac n cheese was old, cold pasta under hot reheated cheese.. I sent that back and got soggy fries as a trade. I was also disappointed that neither myself or my daughter got offered a refill on our drinks or sides, since we are supposed to get free refills. In previous visits, the refills would arrive without being asked. I noticed the table next to ours received their apps after their main course arrived, and i could tell they had waited quite a while as well. The waitress seemed unhappy with the kitchen staff's speed and quality as well. I have been to other Red Robin's and this location does not come close to the quality of others. I was a frequent visitor but I will not be back until I see that the food and service has improved. I can go NYAJs next door for free refills on lime rickeys. Major makeover needed here!

Red Robin is definitely worth the hype.  I'm only deducting 1 star because I'm not sure how their burgers are gourmet. I didn't know Red Robin was a sit down restaurant until we entered.  There's a full bar & flat screens all around so it's easy to catch a sporting event.   I opted for the special Berserker burger which is available for a limited time.  It came cooked medium as I had ordered & had a little kick.  I was expecting it to be a little bit larger than it came but it was enough to satisfy without making me feel like I had gorged myself.  I washed it down with an awesome vanilla malt milkshake & the other half of my wife's burger. All the employees we encountered were extremely friendly & my son walked away with a Red Robin balloon.  I will definitely be back to try more burgers & can't wait for the fall & the return of their Sam Adams Octoberfest milkshake!

Not so smart.  I ended up on a shopping excursion at the mall, and finished too early for a meetup with friends, and too late to make it all the way home and then back out again. And I was hungry. Red Robin was right there, its so damn convenient.  Well, the Red Robin Tavern Double is only available "well done".  So I get the Red Robin Gourmet Cheeseburger, medium please. With a name like that, I am expecting something special.  What i get is an overcooked, still juicy but flavorless burger served on a stale bun.  Its garnished with a bit too much "Tavern Sauce", instead of the advertised Mayo and Pickle Relish, which wasn't too bad, but couldn't save this burger.   We also ordered a Tavern Double, which came out the first time cold.  A second attempt was brought to us promptly, without any fuss, and was quite a bit warmer but certainly not hot.  It was not anything special. The best thing on the plate were the seasoned Steak Fries. Hot and crispy on the outside, soft and fluffy in the middle and seasoned with Red Robin Signature Seasoning (black pepper, celerly seed, cumin, Oregano, sage, garlic and onion, paprika, and dehydrated tomato). Its a pretty good fry.

Well first of all I love cheeseburgers, so trying Red Robin for the first time was exciting for me. I called in a take-out order and the girl on the phone was really nice. The parking situation is great, plenty of spots close and far away. I thought the inside was kinda cool and different, didn't feel like your typical cheesy chain restaurant. Service was good, my order was done in the time frame they told me (15-20 minutes) so that was nice. The take-out boxes came in their own little brown box which was a nice change from your standard white Styrofoam container. The food best of all was reallyyyyy good, which I didn't expect it to be as good as it was. The onion rings were some of the best I've had in a while and the cheeseburger tasted really fresh and everything was perfectly hot. For the price and quality you can't go wrong and I definitely plan on ordering from here again.

My last time here was atrocious. The soup was cold, the fries were burnt and the burger was greasy cold and rancid. The service was sub par. We waited and waited for our terrible food and then actually got charged for the favor. I doubt I would ever go again. Well I took a shot and went back. BIG MISTAKE. I ordered soup again, foolish me. I ordered the Hunk of Burning Love and asked for an Onion Roll bun. Of course it came out on a dusted roll. I give up. Guess I'll be waiting till Monday's and having Applebees burger special.

Solid chain.  Fries are good, however they get you if you want any sauces as those are a la carte.  The staff was super accommodating and sang happy birthday on a Monday night to my 69 year old father and even let us bring in an outside birthday cake to present to him.  If they had a unique veggie burger I think this could be a place with greater appeal, but they just serve your typical boca/Morningstar drab patty.

OK, I usually hate chains..., I came here because we needed lunch and we were going to watch a movie nearby and I wanted a burger... Red Robin has a really catchy ad program right now and I went after the Siracha burger. I got the Bigger tavern patty, with an order of onion rings to split with the wife. Wife wasn't too hungry and only went with chili cheese fries... 1st, the onion rings are awesome, served with ranch and a chipotle ranch or something like that that should be called "crack sauce". The waitress was nice enough to bring me another cup of it for my fries... The place was really clean, table was nice sized, and the little trivia game was pretty fun for me and the wife to play while we waited...  I hate to admit that I really enjoyed this place. The burger was actually decent, as good as a burger from Five Guy's, in all honesty, cheaper too... The wife's fries were huge, and she only ate about half..., I had unlimited fries with my burger, but I barely made it through half mine as well... Service was good, place was clean, meal was cheaper than Smash Burger and Five Guy's, you get a fun little game, and great service. I hate to admit that this chain is pretty good...

My wife and I decided to eat out on a Sunday evening and we've been wanting Red Robin for quite sometime.We all know that the photos and videos are never the same as the real thing, so we weren't looking for anything like a 5 Guys. I ordered the double and the meat just didn't have that beef umph to it. Could have been the burger I ordered.  Little things make me tip waiters. I wanted "lots of lemons" in my water. He didn't bring back lemons. I never said a word. I also told him I was super hungry and really wanted some endless fries and a beer while we waited. He brought the beer but no fries - and we still waited. No fries. Our infant daughter was with us and we asked for steamed carrots in place of the fries with her fish stick meal. Her plate came out with - FRIES. No carrots. My meal finally came out. After we ate our dinner, I let the waiter know about the fries, lemons, and steamed carrots for the baby. His reply? "Awwww. Okay." It sucks that we tip 20% no matter where we go. It's like throwing away money for not-so-good service. In actuality, it's the establishment that my wife and I patronize, not necessarily the waiters. However, I wish all waiters and workers at these established companies would represent their companies a little better than they do.

I'm not a big fan of chains and and after reading some of the reviews, I wasn't very excited when my daughter chose this spot for lunch. We were a party of four on a Saturday around 2. RR was already mobbed but we were seated quickly, maybe a five minute wait. Our server was Victoria, she was friendly and enthusiastic. She was on top of everything and kept the refills coming.  We all ordered different burgers and everyone was satisfied with thier meals.  Lots of gourmet burgers to choose from. I had the southern charm burger(candied bacon, sautéed onions, and honey bbq sauce) and garlic fries and would definitely recommend it. We also ordered the dark chocolate sticks for dessert. They were served cold with strawberry jam and chocolate fudge. So good! Victoria also provided to go cups for those of us who had not finished thier drinks. Sometimes you have to ignore the reviews and try a place yourself. Glad we did,  we'll definitely be back.

I had to revise this review after a very positive experience we had today. My older son loves burgers and has been dying to try the place. Our server was so friendly and accommodating. I loved the fact that they were able to make changes to the menu and didn't charge for every little thing which in my experience is common at chain restaurants. My husband and I were able to have our burgers with a side salad for no extra charge. I guess we could have even gotten a refill but we didn't need it. My younger son got a kids burger   with extra toppings and there was just a small charge for bacon. The other one had soup on the side of his burger for an extra $1.59. The onion rings were terrific and we all loved our burgers. So unlike my last review I thought it was a good value and the food quality was better since my last visit.

Love this place!! Service was great and food was amazing!! The manager is amazing here and is always on the job making sure all is good! Food came out prompt and hot! Our waiter was awesome and very knowledgeable!! We will def be back very soon!!

They always cater to ours son's allergies and keep him safe. The customer service is top notch at this location. The fries and chips are always endless. We usually get the wings (so tasty....) and split a burger because how does one eat a whole one? The manager and servers are super friendly and attentive.

We were looking for a quick, late dinner and decided to give this place a try... never again.  first,, we had to wait 10 minutes for a table even tho the place was half empty. Once we were seated it took 15 minutes for anyone to even acknowledge our presence. from that point on it was just one long wait after another.  Oh, and the food was nothing like advertised.  Don't go here.

Needed something quick while in the area shopping. Came here b/c it was convenient - located in the Warwick Mall shopping plaza. The hostess warned us the floors were slippery - according to other reviews, this seems to be a problem (when we left they were still slippery/sticky). Got seated right away but took our server a little while to finally come over - we were in a rush so we put in our order right away. I got the whiskey river bbq chicken sandwich and my niece got the clucks (chicken tenders) and shrimp. Both came with bottomless steak fries. Our orders came out about 10 mins later - when it was placed down, the server said ok clucks and shrimp and a burger. I said I'm sorry I didn't order a burger - he said oh I'm so sorry - I see burgers all day so I just said burger, but yes this is a chicken sandwich. Umm ....ok? Is it chicken or is it tuna? =) All in all, the food wasn't bad - chicken sandwich had a nice flavor to it and my niece enjoyed her meal, didn't go for seconds on the fries but what we did get was hot and crispy. Although our server was nice, he forgot to bring us a box for leftovers, we had to remind him. If using a credit card, you can now pay directly at the table on a tablet - tip can be added after you've swiped. Wouldn't mind trying again but hopefully the service tightens us.

It was my first time here and i loved the food. I tried the jack tavern burger it was amazing ! Bottomless steak fries were good too. (Yes they are unlimited). 5.50 margaritas everyday was a plus. It truly is a good place for groups and or children. The employees should wear more smiles on they're faces.

If you go, I'm telling you, you NEED to ask for Justina as your server. She works weekends. Justin's was very knowledgeable of the menu/deals, professional and attentive. Literally, the best service I've had in a long time. They didn't have what I wanted in the menu but the chef still made it for me. I wanted a BBQ pulled pork sandwich with cheddar cheese and jalapeños. Only place that makes it the best is Umelt but literally this sandwich was better than any I've had in a long time. The tangy BBQ accompanied with the fresh jalapeños really did it for me. If you go during the week, as for Erika she is great too.

Was a bit wary about coming here after reading the reviews, but I'm glad a did. Our server was super friendly and very attentive. He was always checking on us and giving us drink refills and getting us more bottomless fries. The food was very good as well. I would definitely come back.

I've given this place 3 stars . I've tried this place twice.  I'm not sure why the burgers are suppose to be so great. My husband is a meat eater not me. He suggested in coming here even after the first time there was nothing to really write about. The service is not very inviting. I order the veggie burger that was soggy and undercooked. Good lord!!  By other reviews it sounds like this place needs a good overhaul in all areas. Sorry guys

Let's just say this time around I was not singing the commercial theme song. The service was probably the worst I had ever experienced and I have been to RR numerous times since opening. The apps came almost an hour later and weren't even out in to begin with. The main course, the "bottomless" sweet potato fries were burnt and knarley. Usually my favorite item to order and it was ruined. They of course gave us a new order, but let's just say I wasn't pleased with having to keep complaining about the cold food we were receiving. We went in at 7pm and I wasn't out until 9:20pm. Overall a very bad experience that is making me think differently of returning. Hopefully the Change of new staff and management doesn't continue to bring the service down cause I'm sure many won't be returning.

My family and I first encountered a Red Robins while vacationing in PA, circa early 2000s; so we were quite excited when they opened a location at Patriot's Place, especially the more proximate Warwick location. Their menu is just as good as we had remembered, with numerous choices, at a really good price. My favorite is the Blue Ribbon burger.

Even though Red Robin is a chain, everyone I have gone to has always had great burgers and food, especially this location! Never had to wait to long and always a go-to when I don't want to make dinner. Come and get there food!

HORRIBLE  is the only word I can seem to find...1st my food took 35 MINUTES to get to my table (no management) got my food my wife cuts in to her chicken and COMPLETELY RAW (no management) are bill was cleared  (no management) server took all the heat ....did I mention the server was GREAT and I also mention the through this whole ordeal (NO MANAGEMENT).... HORRIBLE

5-2-17 went again today. Giving cheeseburgers from a chain restaurant 4 stars feels weird. But  I have to give credit where credit is due. Big Tavern cheeseburger is my go to along w/ spicy ketchup for the bottomless french fries (I have never actually wanted more than I was originally given) Ok so it's no Kobe beef. But for an average of $8 or so you can't go wrong. Never had an issue w/service. You can do everything from you table if you'd like (ea table equipped w/those order/pay devices) Bar area has multiple TV's showing more sports shows than I knew were on in the afternoon on a Tuesday.

Haven't been to Red Robin in years so decided to try it out with the hubby. I ordered a guacamole bacon burger with garlic fries and my husband ordered a mushroom burger add bacon to it with garlic fries.  When the food came out there wasn't any bacon on my husband's burger and my burger there wasn't any guacamole. Both of us did not receive garlic fries just regular fries. It is not very busy so I'm not sure how you screw those things up. Our waitress was very nice and apologetic. She went back and made sure the cooks fixed everything. I don't always look at  reviews and judge them by what I read but in this case now I understand why you have 2 and a half stars.

Just decent, nothing to write home about, I  would much rather go to Johnny Rockets the burgers are much better! :-) it's super cold as well, it's like a poor man's Burger King... Wendy's was better than that! What is this amateur hour ? Look around. Oh by the way the bathrooms are a disaster area! Bring your hazmat suit! The woman's bathroom is not much better, the wife said there was  a big turd in the toilet before she ate ,so gross. The clientele I guess is very low class! Poop poop

Sadly, it's not worth it.  It took 15 minutes and finding the manager before any server came to our table. By this point we were ready to order, but sadly the server wasn't ready for us to order and took our drinks. My wife also saw our server hanging out in the bathroom texting on her phone. The manager did offer us a free appetizer and apologized for the mistake. I appreciated his willingness to make us satisfied customers. The appetizer came before our drinks did, though. Some of our food was hot while other food was as if it had been sitting out for a while. The service throughout the meal was subpar at best; refills took a long time, we ordered regular fries but got sweet potato fries (which in some ways was a cool mistake). Poor customer service combine with a slow kitchen and a dirty table (see picture) can really ruin a dining experience.

Food was great, turkey club on croissant and chilli made my night. Party of 6 and we all just wished they wouldn't give such small 1st round of frys, basically forcing you to wait for refill.  Wait staff was great too

Before even being sat, my friend and I were asked if we were both 21. I've never been asked this before ordering a drink and it was slightly embarrassing. We were sat in a very small booth directly in front of the door which made it extremely chilly for us, and near the entrances to the kitchen even though there were several available tables. Throughout the meal, I overheard who appeared to be managers complaining to one another about the employees.  It doesn't make me feel good about eating somewhere when I hear that the hostess has been seating guests at tables that were not wiped down. First we ordered pretzel bites, which were extremely greasy. I didn't like the taste of the beer cheese dip but was unable to ask our server for another dipping sauce because the next time we saw her was when she brought out our entrees.  I ordered the crispy chicken tender salad which sounded great. "...Hard-boiled eggs, hardwood-smoked bacon, tomatoes and Cheddar over mixed greens." The ingredients in my salad that were NOT listed on the menu were the ones that ruined it. Usually in a tossed salad, you don't notice the cabbage and carrots. At least one fourth of my plate was cabbage. I picked out much of it out and was able to see just how much there really was. After I ate most of the lettuce and toppings, I realized that the entire bottom layer was shredded carrots. At least a third of my salad was carrots. My friend insisted on buying me the chocolate fruffles for dessert even though I was ready to go. The fruffles were not soft as advertised in the menu, but came straight from the freezer. They had far too much salt and the berry dipping sauce was sour.

OK - so we give an upgrade to four stars, and provide some valuable advice... Last lousy visit garnered us a business card from the manager offering 2 free entrees and a free dessert...finally decided to cash in... Sat in the bar this time, expecting to get better service, staying away from the overworked dining room staff...this was the right decision. We took a booth in the bar area, and the service couldn't have been better - quick, prompt, and attentive for sure...and I can only assume it's because bartenders and cocktail waitresses (for lack of a better term) understand that service is what keeps customers happy and tips high. Towards the end of the meal, we dropped down the business card...the manager stopped by to ask if they had won us over...we raved and raved about our server, letting him know we'd be back - but sure to sit only in the bar moving forward. I must say, the experience between sitting the bar area vs.s sitting in the dining room is like night and day...

I just want to say that our waitress--sucked. She walked away very quickly after taking our order--which wasn't even complete. She didn't take my order right, so I ended up with a tomato on my burger and the inside was very very pink. I can't eat an undercooked burger. The manager (I think she was) fixed everything and made up for it. She was very attentive, more so than our regular waitress (then again, the OTHER table's waitress was more attentive than ours, sad I know) and she fixed my order and made sure no pinkage happened. She even got our refills on fries and drinks without us having to say anything, she was great. Our waitress took forever to give us change and such too which is a big pet peeve of mine.. Our food was delicious though...AND I haz leftovers :)

Can I leave no stars?!?! Honestly, the place is a joke! Ordered two dinner salads to-go because I didn't feel like cooking. I get all the way home to find out there was no dressing for either salad! Complained to corporate, the so-called manager of the location contacted me and said she wanted to right the situation and took my address to send a gift card to. Months later, still nothing! Burgers are mediocre at best! Save your money and don't waste your time at this dump!!

Ok food but very slow. Not as tasty as other locations and they don't offer free fries before your meal anymore? Normally that would be fine, but if it's this slow offer us some fries so we have something to do.

I've read a lot of bad reviews for this Red Robin so I felt the need to leave an awesome review.  First off, we have always enjoyed great service whether in the bar (awesome if there's a wait for the dining room) or in the dining room. Our favorite waitress is Emily and she has an amazing memory - she remembers us and our order every time! She also is one step ahead of everything you need like drinks, dipping sauces or fry refills. Recently we started getting their new spinach dip (which is amazing) but beforehand we got the fried zucchini and mushrooms (also very good). I am a fan of their royal burger (no pink due to digestion issues). The one time it was accidentally served with pink, they took it back no fuss and replaced it in no time with a hot, juicy, perfectly cooked burger. I also love their whiskey river BBQ chicken wrap. It's always the perfect combination of crunchy tortillas, hot chicken and cold lettuce and tomato with just the right amount of sauce. My fiancé loves the bonzai burger and the royal burger. Their fries are always hot and seasoned very well.  We actually don't go that often due to traffic around the mall, but I'd say we go at least twice a month. Sometimes we just want takeout burgers and go to Five Guys which is closer. However, we still love Red Robin. We are also part of their rewards club and have gotten free birthday burgers and every 10th burger is free. I just can't sing their praises enough!
We love Red Robin - great atmosphere and yummy, quick food.  The service at this location was FAR better than the Foxboro, MA location.  It was a little chilly in the dining room during the winter.

Terrible service - food never arrived. Manager came over and apologized but we left after one hour and still no hamburger. I do process consulting and can see that their kitchen is in disarray and food prep is poorly designed. I hope they get professional help and fire the cost monkey who designed their food prep before it is too late. Fourth and last visit. Only once has food and service gone well at this location - but this was the worst.

Let me start off by saying this rating applies to this location in Warwick RI only as I have had good experiences at other Red Robin locations... I was originally going to review this Red Robin after my first visit which was a very disappointing experience, however I figured they were newly open at the time, new staff so screw it give them another chance or two to win me over, well they haven't. I went in with my family yesterday late afternoon approximately 4pm and the place was slow, very very slow. We were greeted at the front door immediately by the hostess however we had to have her repeat herself a couple of times because the music was so loud we couldn't hear her over it. She seated us promptly and that is where the problems began, I ordered a diet coke and it tasted bad, not like diet coke at all, but I figured OK their mix must be off no biggie happens all the time, any way we placed our order and my son need to use the restroom, so we walked to the restroom, as we rounded the corner we were greeted by a staff member sprawled out in a booth sleeping and continued on our way to the restroom. The restroom was clean however just before traditional dinner time on a Friday evening you should probably ensure your restrooms have paper towels to dry your hands with, as both machines were completely empty. as we walk back to our booth past the sleeping staff member I remember looking at the table thinking wow still no food, considering the place was empty and  our order consisted of 2 burgers, a corn dog for my son and chicken fingers and ribs for my daughter.  When the food arrived the disappointment really set in, Myself, my wife's, and my daughters fries were cold... not warm, cold to the touch cold. Both mine and my wife's burgers were also cold, actually the only thing that was close to hot was my sons corn dog which was actually over cooked but at least it was warm for him to eat.  When the server came back to ask how we were doing we told her of the issues and she went to get her manager, I will give the manager credit as she was very apologetic didn't charge us for anything (not for nothing if she didn't waive the prices, except my my sons corn dog, I would have flipped out as nothing was eaten) But anyway she showed concern, apologized, offered to re cook our meals, and gave us a coupon for 2 free entrees and 2 free kids meals, which we will probably never use. I don't know how this location is so bad and the others I have visited are vastly better but the lack of quality control, and staff control at this establishment reflects poorly on their management.... remember management you can't get away with having to comp food all the time

It gets two stars because I feel the food is good. However, the service is terrible. No matter where I ask to be seated I end up in the bar area. I specifically asked not to be seated in the bar area the last night when I wanted to dine here and use my free birthday burger...so I was told it would be a wait. We waited about 10 minutes then were escorted to the BAR AREA....exactly where we said we didn't want to be seated and why we had to wait. When we told her we asked to not be seated here and asked again if we could sit in the regular dining room she said we would have to go Back on the wait list when there were many tables available. Because of this we left and decided to give a restaurant with better service out money.  I also feel that we get seated in the corner of the bar area everytime because I'm overweight. I have heard of many restaurants doing so.

I've always wanted to like this chain, mostly because I had my first legal beer at one (in British Columbia). With that said ...  Well, it's mall food. If you accept that going in, it's decent food. I had a burger with an egg on top, pretty good but nothing exceptional. If you go in expecting the world's finest burger you'll be disappointed. But it's located in a mall parking lot so you should know better. Bottom line: A passable $8 burger at the mall.

3rd try..  Actually got fries this time and another basket as we left lol...  This place can't get it right.    My burger was way overcooked and very small patties.  All in all another u enjoyable meal.   Waitress never returned I had to pay with that fking tablet.   Don't care she loses out on the tip that way.

How I got dragged here is beyond me, but her initials are K.K.: she's tall, she's bossy, and she wasn't havin' it any other way but her way.  I acquiesced because they have a full bar and the beer promised to be cold. The burgers are regrettable.  Dry, pre-shaped round, banal patties... I customized away the blandy burger bun in favor of the ciabatta roll which did not match the delicacy pictured.  My swiss was cold, I asked for tomatoes and mayo on the side, neither of which came.  I asked for steak fries well-done and got what I don't care for: luke warm potato.   This is quite a happening place on Thursday nights around 5:00 with the family crowd.  I'm talking not a single parking spot left and an actual line to wait in.  We nabbed booth at the bar and were treated to great service.  Ambiance - star, service - star, and that's where the gifting stops.

Was I hungry when I showed up at Red Robin? Yes. Was I hungry when I left? Yes. Did I get a sandwich at Walt's Roast beef for half the price that was more filling just 12 days prior? Yes. That's where the problem is. I had never been to a Red Robin before but it was practically right there upon leaving the Warwick Mall cinema. If you like a snack, but want to feel like you cheated your stomach out of a better deal this seems like the ideal place. The burger my friend got did not seem any different than the chicken sandwich I got... besides the obvious.  Service was great, place was busy, food was done right. Everything was done right except my appetite. I would say more but I need to see what I've got in the fridge.

Awesome place. Gluten free friendly. Waitresses are fantastic especially Robin.  Every time we have a chance we are there. Just had my free birthday burger. Our daughter just loves the onion rings and those endless fries. So go try RED ROBIN YUMMMMM

Reeeeeed Robin...ummmmm? Constantly, I would see these commercials for Red Robin on TV and I really wanted to check one out.  Hell, these burgers have the ability to CATCH CRIMINALS. So, much to my delight, Red Robin kicked Macaroni Grill out of their location next to the Warwick Mall and decided to serve the greater Warwick area with delicious burgers.  They were, in fact, delicious.  However, I'm not sure if most of the staff mentally knew where they were that night. I went there with a friend who shares my excitement for a good burger on a Saturday night.  It was crowded and took awhile to get a seat, but that's expected.  Finally, we were guided to our seat with that smile only seen in training videos that one watches in a closet on their first day. We sat down and I was impressed because there was no napkins.  That's right, I was impressed.  Clearly, these burgers were so good that I wouldn't need to clean up after myself.  Much to my disappointment, this was just an error on their part and I was given napkins. Time to order and when asked for the size of a 12oz or 23oz beer...I clearly had to supersize my order.  When I got it, she brought me a 12oz.  They're already trying to cut me off. Got our food and the burgers were good.  Like finger licking good (luckily I had napkins!)  The fries were your normal type of fries. Well, it was time for us to leave and we requested the check after trying to flag down our waitress.  When we got the bill, we saw the total amount we had to pay: $0.00.  Our meal was free?!  Oh wait...no it wasn't...apparently she messed up on the receipt and put into the computer that we already paid.  After having her fix this, along with trying to charge me for a 23oz that I never got, we paid and went on our merry way. Would I come back?  Probably not.  The staff isn't well trained and most look confused.  If they cooked the burgers themselves, I'm pretty sure I'd be served a bun patty in between two burgers.  That...I would definitely need a napkin for.

I should have read all of the reviews on Yelp before I went to Red Robin in Warwick last Saturday night with my family .  I always love the food here but it can be too noisy for my taste so we don't come often.  The other reason is the service.  I have consistently received slow, mediocre service here.   Last Saturday the service was exceptionally bad.  We ordered two appetizers that were never delivered.  We let another server know about the missing food when our burgers were ordered (45 minutes after we arrived).  From that point on we barely saw our server.  He was clearly going out of his way to skip our table.  My son, who is usually oblivious, commented that the waiter was going the long way around to help his other two tables so he wouldn't have to walk by us.   Red Robin's solution was to give us one free app on our next visit.  Who cares about our next visit?  I wanted satisfaction on this visit.  I understand that it's restaurant industry practice to give something free on the next visit but they could have given us better service on this one to at least leave us with a good impression.

I visited Red Robin once before, but only chose to review today - mainly due to the fact that today's experience was far superior and I thought it was worth noting. The restaurant was able to accommodate a party of 4 at 12:30 on a Sunday afternoon fairly easily, which I attribute to the newness of Red Robin finally wearing off.  We were seated at a very clean booth, and what I appreciated most was the lack of clutter that's seen typically at chain restaurants: various drink promotion cards, the drink/dessert menu, gift card promo cards, salt/pepper, ketchup, malt vinegar...the list goes on. Our waiter was quick to come to the table and get our drink orders, and was attentive without being overbearing. For lunch, I opted for the Souper Sandwich Combo - for roughly $11 you get a full sized sandwich and a side soup. The BLTA (BLT plus avocado on a croissant) was surprisingly tasty. Like really tasty. The bacon was crispy, the lettuce was very green and fresh, tomatoes were sweet and juicy. I was in total shock over how good this sandwich was. The french onion soup was okay, but nothing to write home about.

They've been advertising this place at least 2 years before building this one... what a disappointment.  It's pricey, the portions were nothing to shout about, and the service was pretty bad.  In a sea of other burger joints, it was absolutely NOTHING SPECIAL.  Just another entry on the junk food bucket list, nothing more.

I just finished my second visit to Red Robin. I think it will be the last. It's not good enough for an adult night out, and too expensive for a kids-level meal.  The service is average, while the decor is equivalent to a rough collection of mismatched treasures amassed by the weird older brother of your middle school crush.  Trappings aside, the food is just not that good. The fries are bottomless, but who wants more pale, dry steak fries? The toppings have mild flavor, but the most painful taste offender is the burger. There is something unsavory about the meat... It has very little/ no beef flavor, and the texture is a sponge-like, as though it were a firmish cake rather than a beef patty. I'm not sure it's 100% beef, honestly.  At about $10 for the burger and $2.50 for a soda, this felt like a rip off.  And now for a phrase that has never before crossed my lips: "Go to Applebee's instead."

I don't understand what everyone sees in this place.  The burgers are way overpriced for the quality, the service is lacking, and the food is inconsistent. I went here late on a Saturday night with the family and we all ordered burgers.  We received our meals 45 minutes later accompanied with cold fries.  Ouch.  By that point, we were all so hungry that we ate what we could and promptly left. I do have to say that my burger, Burnin' Love, was pretty good.  But my fries were ice cold.   I was really excited about finding a great place to eat in Warwick, but this isn't it.

I went here last night, there was about a 20 minutes wait which is to be expected for a Saturday night. Our waiter was fast and checked in with us often. The service was excellent. The one problem was that I ordered the French Onion soup and it was way too salty. Aside from that everyone enjoyed their food and it came out after a fair wait time.

Burgers are good - but the staff are a bit childish. I was walking in with my son and husband one day and they neglected to tell me of the step UP to the table so I nearly fell over (with my infant son in hand) they thought it was funny - I say you need to grow up. They have WAY too many staff and while I certainly understand hiring young employees, these kids are WAY immature. Food was good - not noteworthy, but certainly edible and came out hot.

I do not understand all the hype about this place. The decor rivals that of johnny rockets as well as the price range, 9 bucks a burger. I was surprised to see the parking lot full on a Monday evening but they had plenty of room in the restaurant so no wait for a table. Almost everywhere there was family's full of children so I assume perhaps its a family place for a "gourmet" burger. Anyhow, the waitress was decent not to attentive but very nice I almost felt bad I sent the food back. Getting to the food now, the food when I got it was cold to the touch, the tomato on the burger was warmer than the meat. Absolutely horrible, so bad I sent it back! ( I never send anything back, believe me!). I would say that the place needs more organization, the food sat in the window for more than 5 minutes hence the cold burger. Once I complained I got warm food and decent (for previously frozen) fries. The food tasted good but not the best I've had for that price-point.
