Better than the other chains such as chili's, applebee's etc for a burger but I will not go there again.  Try five guy's down the street if you want something cheaper, better and fresh, skip RR's unless your in a bind because it is not a cheap date.

Went in because the commercials finally got to me! It was PACKED for a Monday night, but it was a holiday, so it makes sense. We opted for the bar where we could sit down right away and were instantly asked for our drink order.  Let's stop and talk about something for a minute. Most places have unlimited soda refills. Red Robin has unlimited Root Beer float refills. For real? Too bad I only saw them after I ordered, but the guy next to us was sucking them back like he was Edward Cullen and they were a Grizzly Bear, so they must be good. I ordered the Guacamole Bacon Burger, but opted for the turkey patty instead of beef. My main squeeze ordered the Prime Chophouse Burger. Both were delicious and cooked just the way we wanted them. He got a salad with his and it was big for a side salad.  The bar staff was friendly, and while busy, on top of their game. I will definitely go back and try some other items off of the menu...::cough:: root beer float ::cough::

I like Red Robin and went in to the new location for my annual free birthday burger. Red Robin Royalty club has this one good perk. I used to have to go to Plymouth (near old job) or Patriot Place to get my benefits. It was very busy, I sat at the bar. The bar tender was overwhelmed, but still tried to provide the best service he could. Got the Blue Ribbon burger, cooked as asked, and tasted great. I actually am not a fan of their fries, but they are bottomless if you like them. They do have a good bar with a average selection of beers.

I think it is the staff.  So I am listing 4 stars, it is more in the 3.5 to 3.75.  The burgers are great, but there are a few great burgers around. The place has been pretty crowded the last couple of times I have been there, but the staff is always happy. In both cases I was there, I just managed to go sit at the bar. I have had two different bar tenders, but they were both fantastic. Introducing themselves, making conversation, very attentive.  As for the food, the onion rings are great, the burgers, chicken sandwiches and endless fries are really good.  - Burnin Love Burger (thumbs up)  - Natural Burger (thumbs up)  - Whiskey River BBQ Chicken (thumbs up)  - Royal Red Robin Burger (thumbs up)  And no, I did not eat them all myself. Just three, ok, seriously mine were the Burnin and Royal on two different nights. They were both done really well.  So, in summery:  Food - Good  Service - Great

Red Robin offers bottomless drinks and fries, it also has bottomless hype. The burgers and not by any means gourmet. For lunch today I had a "shroom burger"... the mushrooms were canned, there are few things more disgusting than canned mushrooms. Now, did you all know I gauge a restaurant by its honey mustard? Well, I do. Red Robin passed that test, but it was just ok. The food is truly mediocre at best. The service also leaves a lot to be desired. The waitress was nice however it took awhile to seat us in the almost empty restaurant, the food also came after a prolonged wait and our drinks were not refilled until we were just about to leave. There were a lot of families in the restaurant so it must be pretty kid friendly. I cannot see myself choosing to eat here again. I can get a higher quality burger for less at a lot of other locations.

This was my first time at a Red Robin! I had always seen the commercials on TV but I really wasn't sure what this place had to offer. My husband and I gave it a shot and I was very pleasantly surprised! The place was really busy when we walked in but we got a table right away! I loved the decor! It was fun and bright! Our server approached us promptly to take our drink orders and greeted us with a warm smile! The service was just out of this world! We would get refills without even asking which is a big deal nowadays! That hardly ever happens!  The menu surprised me as well! It had much more than just burgers! There were salads, sandwiches, wraps, and your typical appetizer foods! Everything looked so delicious but I ended up getting a regular cheeseburger and my husband ordered a sandwich.  The food was good, and although I was satisfied, I have had better. My husband ordered broccoli instead of french fries and still got the fries. The fries were good, but tasted even better once I put the Red Robin seasoning on them.  The server gave us a Red Robin Royalty club card so we are sure to be back since the perks of the card seem doable and tasty! I will definitely be back!

"REEEEEEEEEEEED ROBIN...YUUUUMMM!" I've eaten at Red Robin a few times now since they finally opened up one here in Rhody. After reading some of the reviews, I honestly don't know why most of them are so negative about this place. I work in a restaurant myself and work through rush hours. It's nothing to be happy about trust me when you have people hounding you all at once...but to be honest I've yet to have a bad experience here. The food is just awesome. First time I came here with my girlfriend and one of my good friends. My girlfriend is from Texas so she knows how Red Robin is, but as for me and my friend we've never tried it. I went ahead and ordered the Wiskey River BBQ Burger with endless fries and mac & cheese. First off let me just say that that burger was one of the juiciest I've eaten in a long time from a fast food joint. I also put some of that special spice blend they leave on the table and it absolutely rocked on my burger. Very tender, juicy, and hearty and it gave the burger lots of flavor. I ate the whole thing. The fries were really good and so was the mac & cheese. That meal gets an A from me. The waitress we had was really pleasant as well. It was worth the money I'd say.  The second time I came here I tried the Burnin' Love burger. If you've read some of my reviews you know I'm a Spice Lord, and this burger was full of it no doubt. Juicy, spicy, steamin' hot and really good. I enjoyed it! I was offered more fries but unfortunately I couldn't go another round. The burgers so far are awesome and hopefully next time I stop in I'll try some of the chicken or a different burger.  Like I said I have yet to experience a bad time here. I mean c'mon people, this is Rhode Island what do you expect...where are you gonna find southern hospitality around here? All that matters is that the food was totally awesome and I plan on coming back for more! The only con I have is that every time I've come here so far, I ALWAYS catch someone falling on the way down to the dining area. You guys might wanna fix the floor over there on that small "hill" or add a rug because people keep falling down. One of my friends actually fell too. Just a suggestion.

I came to the RR in Warwick last Saturday. I have eaten at the one in Patriots Place once, and both the service and quality of food really did not make me want to come back to a RR anytime soon. But I decided what the heck why not! We were seated almost immediately, and I must say the food was much better than my last experience. I know it used to be the old Macaroni Grill, but still very spacious and a very cool atmosphere.  Our waitress was on her A game. I swear not once did  I ever have to ask for a refill! As soon as my glass was half full she was right on top of getting me a refill. When does this ever happen today?!?! My favorite is the Whiskey BBQ Chicken Wrap. Plus you can buy the seasonings they use on their burgers for $3.00 for each bottle. I have already used the seasonings a couple of times while cooking on my grill and I must say, very delicious! Overall  I was very happy with the service and food.

Great trading burgers, a tad pricey, so for us it is an occasional treat.  Like the Speckled Lemonade and bottomless fries. Saturday lunch was no wait and very fast service.  Robin (not "the" Robin) was our waitress.  Very attentive and pleasant.

Went back again this weekend and while the food was again acceptable, what really stood out this time was the poor service.  The staff was friendly, but they really seem to struggle at some basic things, like providing silverware and napkins to the tables.  It wasn't just our table that was lacking these items, which we received only after asking for them after our burgers arrived, but almost every table around us also had the same problem.  Did they not buy enough flatware when they opened?  Are the servers just not aware that even if patrons don't need flatware because it's a burger place, we may perhaps need napkins? Lastly, when our burgers were delivered, the guy (not our original waitress) asked if we wanted another drink and I ordered a beer, but that never arrived.  We noticed the table next to us also ordered drinks that never arrived. I wish they could get their service issues resolved, but I doubt they ever will.  Just doesn't seem like they have a clue about this stuff.

Ugh I normally don't complain or send back food bc I am a bartender, but I had the clam chowder and obviously it was powder based. I knew because the powder blob popped in my mouth and it was just an awful flour texture. Will not be returning for that! Had the jalapeño burger and it wasn't made the way the menu described.
Who doesn't love Red Robin? Yumm...

Ate at one in tampa, Fl, came to this one in Warwick, dont know why... Nothing special..Salad was sloppy and we wer all slipping cause the whole Floor was slippery...  Should of done the hour wait at PF changs.

"Red Robin yummm" more like "Red Robin mehhh". The service here is decent but nothing to rave about. The burgers are disappointing. For a place that prides and its self on burgers and advertises them non stop they are so mediocre. Red Robin is just an adults Friendly's without the ice cream. Thanks but no thanks. I don't think I'll find myself here again unless I'm out driving along and super hungry and the only thing around is a Red Robin.
Great service, phenomenal food, friendly staff all  makes for quite an enjoyable meal

I've been to a lot of Red Robins in the past, but this one always seems to disappoint me in someway or another. I went the other day for lunch & the service was HORRIBLE. The hostess greeted us right at the door & sat us immediately in a basically empty dining room, then said the waitress would be right over. My dad & I waited about 10 minutes before any server came to our table & all she did was introduce herself, then walk away. About 5 minutes later, she came back to take our orders for food & drinks at the same time. My dad ordered a water with lemon & I ordered an iced tea.. pretty simple right? We ordered an appetizer & meals for ourselves too. About 15 minutes later, our appetizer came out... but our waitress still hadn't brought our drinks over. We flagged her down & she brought them over, then informed me that the kitchen was out of broccoli, so I asked what other vegetables they had & she said carrots so I got those instead. When our meals FINALLY came out, she dropped cold carrot sticks off at my table as my side, when I was thinking they were at least going to be steamed or seasoned or SOMETHING. It's not like I ordered a kid's meal. She never checked on us to see how our food was, & it took her forever to drop off our bill. I've worked in a restaurant for years & would NEVER treat one of my tables like that. I have no idea why everything took so long because there were probably less than 8 tables total in the entire restaurant. My family & I will most likely not be returning.

First time ever eating here last week! The waiter was out of this world, really cool/funny down to earth guy. Wish I caught his name (dark hair, very talkative, loves to drink ) anyways.. Even if the food sucked if go back for his service alone. But alas the food was excellent! I got some sort of BBQ chicken wrap.. And all you can eat fries!!?? That's crazy, coming back for sure!!

i came back again with my roommate and a coworker. the thought of the freckled lemonade shouldn't get out of my mind! we walked in on this hot summer day and were seated promptly by a friendly host. i just wish we hadn't been sat by the kitchen so i didn't have to hear the staff gossiping.. the last time i came here, a bartender named albert was our server and i wish we had him again. today we had.. donie? i'm pretty sure that's his name. he started off with an inviting offer of freckled lemonade as he was introducing himself. it was as if he was reading my mind! this was actually the only thing he did right in my book. albert told me last time i was here that i could substitute a veggie patty for any burger that was on the menu. so that's exactly what i did this time. i ordered the same burger that i did last time and before i even took a bite i saw a nice piece of bacon sticking out. now is it just me but if a guest asks to have a veggie burger wouldnt you ask if they wanted bacon or even question it for that matter? yuck. other than that he was very polite and courteous he just needs a little more sense of reading people.

It's just burgers and fries. I'm just not that impressed. The amount of calories I witnessed other members of our party consume in one sitting alarmed me. Free refills on root beer floats + free refills on steak fries = dangerous... Aggressive birthday party singing scared my 3-year-old.

Red Robin is the new place in town and oh I wanted to try it so bad! Especially the pictures online, their menu pictures, just so mouth-watering. I went with a group of healthy eaters and maybe I didn't thoroughly enjoy my burger because of that but I'm not sure... so I'm giving them a 3 star, I didn't really like the burger I had. I had the blue cheese burger. I was hoping for full blown flavors from all angles because of the burger patty + sauce + blue cheese = heaven... but it wasn't so much the case. It was good, but disappointing because I was hoping for more flavor. I'll probably give them another shot without my salad eating friends. A mention on the service, it was spectacular. I suspect because it was the first 2 weeks of opening, but I'm hoping their service remains this great forever.

My boyfriend and I have been wanting to try this place for some time . Today, we had the opportunity to go and I tell you, no bueno. I ordered a double cheeseburger and he had a regular cheese burger . We ordered the burgers well done. My boyfriends burger was raw inside and greasy. Mine came out well done but was very greasy as well. The meat was cheap and tasteless (not what I would expect for a gourmet burger) . We told the waitress that the burger my boyfriend received was not cooked the way he ordered it and we did not even get an apology.  The table next to us had the same problem. First and last time. Five guys is much better than this crapola.

Easily worst red robin ever.  Food was all overcooked, don't offer 'some pink' for a burger if you're just going to turn it into a charcoal briquette anyway. Not only this but my whole family felt sick after and I ended up throwing up later that day because my stomach was so upset. Cooks here are incompetent, undertrained, and clearly don't care. The only redeeming quality of this red robin is the managers. They were attentive and caring, the only reason I would even slightly consider going back to any red robin chain. As far as this one, I have no desire to step anywhere near it for fear of getting sick again. No thank you.

My first time trying this burger place I was excited....however after getting my food I was a little let down. The burger itself had no flavor but the toppings were good. The wait staff was friendly but, the wait was long for a Sunday evening and the establishment was less than halfway full. Overall it was pretty average, the burgers weren't as gourmet as I thought. I will say it would be a better choice than a Burger King or a McDonalds.

This was my second time visiting this establishment.  I love the burgers, but the wait is ridiculous.  Two other tables that were seated long after us, got there food first.  We even had to wait 15 minutes for the drinks we ordered to arrive.  When the waitress finally brought them over, she apologized and said she thought someone else was going to bring them over?? We both ordered burgers and fries.  I could have dined at a five star restaurant and got my food faster.  Once again, the waitress apologized and stated that they messed up on one of our hamburgers??  Oh and my friend asked for her hamburger to be well done and it came back pink.  I am guessing that her hamburger was the one they messed up and after we asked when we would be receiving our order, they rushed it through. Believe me, we did not even make a fuss, but it was so apparently bad that the waitress sent the manager over to apologize.  He wanted to give us a hamburger to take home which we declined.  They ended up taking 10% off the bill. I think I will give this another try in the future because I do like the hamburgers.  Hopefully the service will be vastly improved.

My girlfriend and I went to this red robin for lunch on a Sunday. We go to red robin quite frequently and I was very disappointed with this location. For starters, I asked for a blended margarita and they brought it to me on the rocks. Not a big deal, I can get over that. Then, it took about fifteen minutes for me to get my appetizer while there were servers standing all around us gossiping which made me feel like no one was concerned about my food. The bartender sink was filled with trash and dirty napkins while the bartenders stood there talking about things I didn't care to hear. When my burger finally arrived after waiting for twenty minutes, it had a hair in it. So I had to send it back and wait another ten minutes before I could eat. My girlfriend ordered the French onion soup and it was literally all cheese and hardly any soup. Very disappointing. Thankfully the manager took my fifteen dollar burger off the menu or I might have killed somebody. Overall I am very disappointed with this red robin and will not be revisiting.

My nephew has always liked this place for reasons i can't say. I have NEVER like the food quality or the taste. (I personally would go to TED's Montana grill or 5 Guys for a burger.) This last time not only was the last for even my nephew. His burger came to him RAW, my friends prime rib sandwich was a joke filled with tough meat and grizzle. The garlic fries were soggy and had that fake minced garlic from a jar. We sent back the burger and the prime rib sandwich ( I sent back the fries because I do not wast my time on bad food) telling them the problem.  Now they don't comp anything but they bring another burger for my nephew and friend ask for a burger instead, plus give us some more of there all you can eat fries. On top of that the managers will not leave us alone !!!!!! we could not even try to eat in peace now. Top it all off now my nephew has been sick since we came home from that place. I am so glad i ate a veggie burger.

Very disappointed! Our server was quite nice; but appeared overwhelmed on her 2nd night. While it wasn't her fault, felt rushed & ignored while we were here. No silverware when we sat down, she relayed kitchen was working to remedy. Took drink and food order. App arrived before drinks delivered by a runner. A manager stopped by to ask how the apps were before we had even had a chance to taste and it was more of a walkby because was already asking another table before I had chance to answer. The waitress arrived and apologized for delay, explaining someone behind us had an allergic reaction and she had to report it to a manager for a report to be filled out. She had just moved on to next table she had drink order for when another runner had our entrees, less than 4 minutes later. I HATE that! The waitress came by again to apologize, check that we were ok, ask if we'd like another drink and would be back with them & was gone until I was done with entree and actually set for check.  The food-for all the commercials & money in other advertising, I have had better burger at mom & pop places around town for far less cost. Overall, dissatisfied, don't think I will be back anytime soon.

First I have to say the burgers are pretty good that is why I put 2 stars, if it weren't for the burgers, 1 star all day.  Service is horrible, so we have had take out a couple of times and I can't begin to tell you how often we are give more ketchup packets than fries. I've called and complained, but to No avail.

I want to love this place badly.  Alas, I cannot as they do NOT want me to.   The food is okay.  It is not bad, not good, it's just okay.  The service on the other hand is horrible.  I have had one good server in my five or six visits.  She did an okay job as a server but was really nice and tried to make sure we were taken care of.  That was the only redeeming factor to that visit.  The servers are more often than not uninterested in the service they give you and more interested in socializing with each other.  My expectations are not high for a place such as this but when you manage to disappoint me, even with those low expectations, there is most assuredly a problem.  I do not foresee another trip to this establishment.  As they say fool me once shame on you, fool me twice shame on me, fool me five times......what am I stupid.

I read recently that they just started serving gluten-free hamburger buns...so naturally I had to try it immediately.  It was AWESOME.  Possibly the best damn gluten-free bun I have ever had...ESPECIALLY coming from a fast food restaurant.   For the two minutes it took me to inhale the burger, I felt like a normal person, eating a normal-person cheeseburger.  I completely forgot it was gluten free...HORRAY!!!  The only reason I gave it four stars instead of five is that they MUST start labeling the gluten-free items from the regular items.  I almost ate my boyfriend's wheat bun which could have been a nightmare...I mean REALLY REALLY BAD.  I called to verify which order was which and the manager thankfully was able to differentiate between the two burgers.   FYI: the gluten free bun does NOT have sesame seeds.  Other than that...it was a pretty slammin burger.

Terrible. We went one night before we went to the movies.   We waited about 45 minutes for our food and there were probably about like 10 people in there.  The servers were never to be found.  We waited 18 minutes on the dot for our drinks and we only ordered a soda and a water.  My Boyfriend got a burger medium well - it was covered in some weird mayo sauce that was hot, but once he got to the center he noticed it was extra pink and cold so he didnt finish it but we were sick of waiting for waiters to come by, and by that time he didnt want anything to do with any of the burgers. We were already late for our movies anyways.  The waiter never even offered to recook it or take it off the bill.   Then the bill came it was 40$ I was so ready to walk out.  He ended up with food poisoning and in the hospital 2 days later.  it was awful.  we will never be back there.

We called ahead for a takeout order after spending a few hours at the Warwick mall.  The restaurant itself is very cool, great atmosphere, plenty of tables, and a cool bar.  The bartender who handled my order was very friendly and took care of getting my to-go food quickly.  We tried the Gourmet Cheeseburger and the Shroom Burger both were still hot when we arrived home and delicious!   The thick burger patties were cooked to the proper temp of medium, were seasoned well, and had fresh lettuce, tomato's, onions, etc...  The fries were tasty too!  We will be back.

Awful, awful, awful. My husband and I went to RR on a Friday night. We were told it would be a 20 minute wait, but we waited for over 30 minutes. I don't mind waiting, but I'd appreciate being given a real idea of what the wait is going to be. We were finally seated and then waited another five minutes before we were even greeted by the waitress. She apologized for the wait and took our entire order, since we had plenty of time to look at the menu at that point. We ordered drinks, an appetizer, and an entree. The drinks showed up but the appetizer never came I didn't see the waitress at all or I would have asked where the appetizer was. Fifteen minutes later the entrees came and I asked to just cancel the appetizer order. The waitress apologized and said she would ask if she could take it off the bill. She also said the manager would be over to speak with us but he never came over even though he walked past our table several times. The food was very unimpressive. My husband ordered a $10.50 burger that has been heavily advertized in print and on TV, but the burger he got looked nothing like the one in the commercials. After the meal was over, the waitress brought the bill. We wanted to pay with cash but we needed change. We waited over ten minutes for the waitress to come back to pick up the cash/give us change but finally I just went up to the bar and asked for change there. Bottom line: Food: overpriced and underwhelming Service: shoddy at best

The last time i went here was the LAST TIME. Gross cold fried appetizers, unpleasant server (place was dead so why not be attentive?). Asked several times for kids balloons to entertain them. Forgot my kids drinks. Never again and my kids loved the atmosphere the first time so for a parent thats saying something. I guess the need to prove something faded with the "new restaurant" label?

Great service but Restraunt was out of a lot of supplies. The food was greasier than other Red Robbins we have eaten at. Instead of telling customers they were out of food ingredients they substituted other items to pass off. Waitress Ariel was super nice but food was not worth coming back for.

I have been here a couple of times.  Both times I found the service to be a little slow, but the food and drinks made up for the wait.  They have such a variety of hamburgers.  Each time, I tried a different one and they were both delicious.  The menu is quite extensive so I think I will keep going back and trying different menu items.

Went there for the first time a couple of weeks ago. I love cheeseburgers and had heard the hype. Walked in and was seated right away. I ordered the cheeseburger rare. I might have accepted medium rare. The waiter said they don't do that and he "might" get the cook to leave a little pink in the middle. I left.

Our family's first Red Robin experience was hovering around a one-star rating, but maybe because I was in a  good mood, I'll give them a four instead for turning around an epic disaster. Let me explain. We visited early on a Sunday afternoon at a very busy hour, and was told there was a 25 minute wait. We were in no hurry, and the family had been looking forward to the visit, so we chose to hang around and tough it out. As our 25 minute wait morphed into a 45 minute wait, we noticed that there were several empty tables, but no one was being seated. We were also watching the frenetic kitchen staff try to fill the 30 or more hanging order tickets visible from the dining room. Something was wrong. Two obnoxious elderly women, who had been seated, walked out saying they had been waiting over an hour for their orders and gave up, instructing us to follow them out. The hostesses were receiving severe grief from nearly everyone by now, and their stress levels were visible and likely at an all time high. Customers entering the front door were being turned away. Who knows why we chose to hang around. After an hour, with the dining room nearly empty, we were finally escorted to our table. Our server was friendly and eager to apologize. She said something went wrong in the kitchen and they were unable to fill any orders for a while. That's when they decided to no longer seat people. She said a group of employees who were on their way to Nashua to open another restaurant were re-routed and called in to get things back into shape. Our server was attentive, pleasant and fast, despite the drama, and our orders came out hot, fresh and delicious. I ordered the "Royal Red Robin Burger" that included a fried egg. Honestly, other than adding cholesterol to the meal, I'm not sue what purpose the egg serves since you can't taste it with all the other flavors in the burger. And who can argue with bottomless steak fries? Our server went out of her way to be sure we were taken care of,and dropped by the table often to express her appreciation for our patience. We could have easily walked out early on and never returned. With some background working with the public, I sympathized with the staff and was impressed with how they pulled things together and gave my family a good meal and good experience. Good thing for them, I guess, I wasn't in a hurry.

With so many great places to eat in RI it is hard to believe these guys can keep their doors open. I have eaten here twice and it is basically overpriced, run of the mill, average food. I am not saying it is bad but it just is; I feel major buyers remorse after spending $20-$25 on a burger, fries, and a drink. On the positive the service was descent and the bathrooms were clean on both visits.

My church had a youth night and we decided to come here for dinner before heading to the movies.. We waited 15 mins to be seated. Which is ok.. However when we finally were  getting seated there was food all over the floor at are table which was disgusting.. Took them another 2 minutes to clean it.. We finally got seated, took another 5minutes just to order water...my appetizers came before the group received there waters! Really? ..are meals finally came. My burger was not cooked well done as I requested. And the buns felt as if it was sitting in the heat for two days. My sister had a salad that they did not have right. Nobody came to check on us to see if we were doing ok, no re fills on drinks till the bill came in. That's when I told the manager how I felt after he asked how the service was . And he seemed to get upset with my honesty and he quickly became defensive. He then offered to take my burger and the salad off the bill...Saving me a few bucks didn't make the experience any better. I don't know what it will take for me to come back.

My boyfriend and I went to the Red Robin at a new location of Bald Hill Rd in Warwick and we had to wait for 20 minutes because it was packed but it was worth the wait. The waitress Annie that took our order was very polite and our food came out quick and I enjoyed my bbq chicken wrap sandwich and my boyfriend enjoyed his chicken sandwich and the bottomless fries were hot. We will definately will be going back there again and I will be taking my friend there for her birthday in October :)

From the time that I walked in to the time I left I had the best service as well as the best experience ever. The first time I came here was on Veteran's Day where  I had awesome service. However it would  not be wise for a company not to piss off a former service woman..definitely not  a good look but the  meal and service was great. Though the place was busy as hell,the waiter was attentive and friendly.  Yesterday I was starving before I wanted to stroll over to Macy's so I stopped by.( Getting my free birthday burger is another plus) I was greeted with a smile by a really sweet hostess. We talked for a little bit and waited for the waiter. My waiter came over...yea wow....tall, killer smile, hot (and hopefully single lol )..he would have been flawless  but for the Red Sox shirt he was wearing,but everyone working there was wearing one so maybe there is hope. Anyway when I was done drooling over my waiter, I believe the manager came over and sat down at my table. He was so adorable. So nice.  We chatted for a bit. He took my order and I waited for my Banzai burger to be made. I used to frequent the Wareham location and even the one in Milford CT. Cooking a burger is pretty simple. I like my well done which is simply leave on the grill until it's fully cooked. For some reason the other two locations can't figure that out, my burger yesterday was on point. Everything was awesome . Seriously, I felt like they rolled out the red carpet for me yesterday. It was crazy. I've been to some high priced places and I can say not one place has treated me like they did yesterday at a burger joint. A really hot waiter was the perfect touch too. In all seriousness, I was more than taken care of and I really do appreciate it.
Love the Red's gourmet cheese burger and the side salad is excellent. Bartender makes a great  margaritas

After ignoring my existence at the bar register for 5 minutes, the employee actually walked away. There was no I'll be right with you, no can I help you, nothing. When she came back without so much as looking at me, I actually had to ask her if this was where I would place my take out order, if only to remind her to do her job. The food was good, but portions were kinda small for the price.  We enjoyed our burger, salad, and sweet potato fries, but my son's grilled cheese was way below average.  I had a delicious drink while I waited for the food to come out, freckled lemonade. The bartender was nice, not very attentive though since I sat for awhile and had to ask for a drink instead of being offered service. What am I, invisible?  I would probably go again, but not for take out.

This was my second time at this Red Robin and for a middle of the week evening it was pretty busy. We got seated within 5 minutes of arriving though which wasn't bad. Our waitress came right over and took our drink order and since we knew what we wanted we placed our burger order too. Although the service was a bit slow the staff was very friendly and the burgers were very good. I was stuffed when I left and definitely had no room for dessert. I don't know why the reviews are so terrible - it's a burger place and much better than any fast food joints around.

I was SO excited to try this place since they are the only place around serving gluten free burgers with a bun! I really really really wanted it to be good. Unfortunately, the only two things that were good were the service (waiter was friendly, attentive, and knowledgeable about gluten free items) and the strawberry milkshake. And, one more thing, the gluten free BUN was good as well. The fries were lukewarm, soggy, and mostly very undercooked. The burger had no flavor, and neither did the cheese. The bacon was so thin I could see through it, and there were only 2 small slices on the burger. No good. I guess I'm back to getting Five Guys take out and slapping it on a gluten free bun at home.

Food was good. Service was not as good. They have bottomless fries so why would you be skimpy on the fries with your order. It would save the waiter time and the customer aggravation. I had to wait long periods of time for refills on my drink and when I needed ketchup or napkins the waiter was nowhere to be found. This red robin is new and once they filter out the bad waitstaff I am sure the experience will be better
been here a few times. family place. food is crap. they charge chain prices for fast food taste. the service was mediocore at best. there are so many better options on rt 2 instead of this place.

Went to Red Robin a few weeks ago...never again! Ok, sit down and wait 10 minutes for our server to come over. Order their famous onion rings, they have run out of them! What? It's 1:00 on a Saturday. Order the guacamole and chips, the waitress tells us "Even though it's on the menu, we are not serving that yet".  Again, what?? Oder the chicken tenders and wait and wait. Waitress comes back to see what we want for lunch, we order and ask where our tenders are. "Oh, they will be right out". She says. Waiting, waiting...and here she comes with our burgers!! Ok, one more time, What??? They sent our appetizer to the wrong table. Do we still want it? No I say, just the burgers and the check when you have a minute. Manager comes over apologizing profusely...this meal is on us, she says and gives us vouchers for another meal. Ok, they screwed up but they are making a valiant effort to recover. Bill comes? Charged us the full meal...NEVER AGAIN. Now we have to grovel to the waitress asking for something that was already promised to us. Waist of time.

My wife and I tried the new RR in Warwick, RI. this past Sunday evening.  The wait time was only about 15 mins.  The staff was friendly and knowledgeable  about the items on the menu.  The prices are the norm for the area and type of restaurant RR is.  My wife had a burger and I had the BBQ chicken wrap, both were good.  The fires (bottomless) were good also.  I did hear a customer complaining to the manager about how difficult it was to eat the burger.  The burger comes wrapped in a paper pocket and it is advisable to not totally unwrap it to eat it (these are loaded burgers).  It may be a good idea for RR to purchase a "bib" like you sometimes get for eating lobster.  It would eliminate the complaining customer who refuses to keep the Burger wrapped, (just a thought).  I would recommend RR to friends (to visit and form their own opinion, everyone one has different taste).  We enjoyed the food, the friendly staff and the service, we will surely visit RR again.
